This game is a lot of fun. Not only is it a zombie game, but if you want to survive, you really have to work well together as a squad. The online play is always great fun!

Killing Floor is a fast paced, wave-style, FPS.  Kill hordes of mutated monsters by yourself or with six other players in multiplayer mode, or brave the one man challenge and play solo. Choose from seven different perks as well as assorted weaponry to assist you in your mutant-slaying.  This game also allows for map editing, providing numerous player made maps.  If you love gore, killing mutants/zombies, or wave-style battle, this game is for you!
Hated it when I first played it. Gave it another try, loved it. Play with friends, not public people.

Killing Floor delivers fast pace zombie killing action with normally up to 5 others as you fight to survive the numerous specimens tracking you down.

Okay, simple game, grab some guns and try not to get killed, the game is based on waves, 1 through 10 (or 7 or 4) and then a finale round with the big bad boss, between each wave you get 1 minute to recover, purchase new weapons and choose what class perk to take.

With many different perks from the melee wielding berzerker to the shotgun carrying support to the rocket launcher explosives expert, this game has something fun for everyone.

And dont be worried that the game will be easy, with 5 difficulty setting ranging from Beginner to Hell on Earth, their will be a level of difficulty for everyone can have fun on.
fun zombie game, not the best graphics but beats the crappy guns in left for dead 1
Great shooter. Great game to play with friends.

It's unfortunate that Killing Floor came out around the same time as Valve's Left 4 Dead franchise, because the two are equally excelent and so different from each other. Killing Floor has you holed up in a medium to large map surviving waves of zombies as you pick your class, weld doors and buy weapons from traders. The gameplay is great -- a lot of care was put into this game and it still shows years later. The player base ranges from godly to retarded. The graphics look dated, although weapons have an incredible level of detail to them. The sound effects are good, but the music is downright abysmal; it sounds like your 12 year-old next door neighbor's Nu-metal band practicing. Lastly, they have a few very inexpensive DLC available (nothing game-breaking, just character skins) which are very high quality if you're looking for some variation after a few dozen hours of gameplay. Did I say a few dozen? I meant a few hundered. This game is addicting as fuck.
This game is seriously fun.  It's quick, graphics are great and it's just awesome to wholesale kill 'specimen'.

If you are a fan of horror and enjoy quality FPS this is a great title to play. Don't expect much story, but the mechanics are solid. The maps have great atmosphere and there are plenty of free community maps to enjoy. Also unlike many other FPS titles, you can level up your weapons (perks) in this game. I have played 219 hours - well worth $20 (9 cents per hour).
This scratches your zombie-killing itch in a way other games of this type don't. Visceral and bloody good fun.

One of the best Zombie/Co-Op Survival Horror games out there! 
Good things: Tons of fun/Great team game/ Wide range of difficulties/Tons of maps/Varied guns (ADS is very nice feature)/Populated/Nice perk system/Mobs are varied(to a degree)/Boss is fun
Bad things:  Eventually the game feels a little samey with wave on wave/Only one type of boss/Perks are a real chore to level up/Soloing isn't fun/No story mode/No other modes besides killing things

For what it is, it's a intense co-op fps, relying on teamwork to survive each wave, to then overcome the big boss.
This game is fun, and with friends alot of fun. However this games does start to feel bland after a while. 
This game has huge potential. If some sort of story mode/mission mode was set, more bosses and mob types - just generally expanding on what it is, this game could easily be a bestseller on PC and consoles.
Overall, a good game!
My score: 8/10
Should you get it: Yes, yes you should.

Very fun, addictive and challenging wave survival game.
The better your team, the better the fun.

In Killing Floor, you band together with up to five other players to survive wave after wave of ugly clones who want to rip your face off. Pick one of the seven player perks (you can change yours per wave) for bonuses to things like healing and damage done. Buy weapons that will help fend off the fuglies. Weapons are 'aligned' to perks and will be more effective when playing that specific perk!

Killing Floor is regularly updated by Tripwire Interaction with new maps, weapons, achievements and player models in the holidays, to give people a reason to keep playing. At the core, KF is the same as it was upon Steam release, but that consistency along with the content updates are why people have been playing this non-stop! Join in the bloody fun and support your team online!

KF is not a complicated game but there is plenty to learn about it, and to that end there are a whole bunch of guides to help you out with learning the fine details of the game mechanics. Never be afraid to ask questions either, as you knowing more about the game is a good thing for your team.
If you're going to purchase Killing Floor, try checking out a beginner's guide (like the one I'm working on!) and jumping in a low difficulty game with a friend to get acquainted with the game.

Note: Your gameplay experience, as ever, varies depending on your playstyle and behaviour as well as that of other players you encounter. While there are many decent and nice players out there in public games, it's always recommended to play with at least one friend!

Buy this...
-If you like a little RPG element in your shooting games. 
-If you want a game where teamwork is key to victory. 
-If you prefer to play shooter games where you have to think a little. Not every perk/weapon combination is good and not everyone can take on all types of enemies. Sometimes you have to leave a specimen for your teammates or run, regroup and retry!
-And if you like your 'horror' games to have more than the garden variety slow zombie in them.

Don't buy this...
-If you're expecting Left 4 Dead, there are some similarities (some of the clones may remind you of L4D's special infected) but where L4D is a fast-paced action shooter, KF tends to be based more on tactics and decision making, for example deciding who plays with which perk in the team and who takes on what role.
-If you want to jump into higher difficulty games instantly. 'Zeds' (clones/specimens) on higher difficulties are tougher and more dangerous. To be able to take them on you need to put in the time to learn about the game and raise your perk levels!
-If you want your wave survival games to only stop when you die for a high score. At the end of the game (4, 7 or 10 waves depending on the server setting) you will face a boss and either end up victorious or you will be killed. Either way, the game ends and you'll start a new map!

Can be a little repetitive with wave after wave of the same enemies, but really you can not help but enjoy yourself as you slice, shoot, and detonate your way through hordes of enemies, even after the 20th+ time.
This game is awesome, I have had hundreds of hours of fun with it. I strongly reccomend it.

"An FPS with a dash of RPG leveling up in it-- along with boatloads of zombies, gore, and funny British people. You will frequently play with stoner metal head kids who will ponder zombies as a symbol of our society's lack of substance, pervasive psychological alienation, and slavery to greater (corporate, government, etc.) forces. Between tokes of weed and transforming into a zombie slaughtering machine amidst waves of rotting corpses, you will ask yourself, "Who truly is the zombie here?". Also after playing this game, you will be thoroughly convinced any game that doesn't have metal music playing in the background is for fucking pussies. A breath of fresh air in a barren video game wasteland full of angry competitive FPS gamers, MMO nerds with B.O., and weird Asian kids who are good at everything. A true triumph of the human spirit...9.7/10."

Great action survival game. The RPG element is fun, the difficulty levels are varied, and the specimens each have a distinct look and feel to them. A must buy for anyone who likes survival game types.

Great co-op horror game, I'd highly recommend this game to anyone looking for a fun, social way to kill zombies.

Well this game is really refreshing actually it has an element of suspense, surprise and at times pure (not seen often) fear. at times that fear of death gives an adrenaline rush depending on class you choose keeping your play accurate and precise. This game also has a quite exiting multi-player that completely changes the feel of the game with a great blend of team work and planning that is needed in a wave based survival horror like this. Killing Floor also has a perk(class) based leveling system based on how you like to play, for example if you like to cut, slice, and dice your way through hordes of specimens the berserker class would be the best for you. say you like to heal teammates then enjoy the medic class with a special 85% price cut in the shops on the deadly and fast medic-gun. each class has different ways to help you in each wave which only gets better as you level . . This game in the long run is pure refreshing entertainment that's worth the 19.99 So are you ready?
Good Coop Game

Killing Floor is truly a great game for anyone who is a fan of zombie shooters. You face wave after wave of various zombie types until you reach the boss wave. Many weapons to choose from, many distinct skins, and multiple upgradeable perk classes allow you to really customize your character to suit your style of play. Melee? We've got swords and chainsaws. Support? Pick your favorite shotgun and a bandolier full of grenades. Commando? Grab an assault rifle and show them how it's done in America. Hell, there's even a flamethrower if you're feeling particularly chaotic. Rock out all alone in solo mode, or make a team of up to 6 people for internet play. Not a very in-depth story behind the game, but it never gets boring and it offers infinite replay value.
Fast paced and more fun than you can imagine.  In many ways better than Left 4 Dead.

If you like Left 4 Dead (1 or 2), then you will probably like this little gem from Tripwire. Co-op survival horror gets a bit of British flavor in Killing Floor with the witty and often hillarious banter from the characters ("You call yourself a bloody zombie?!"). The innovative use of 'iron sights' makes sighting-in feel comfortable and realistic and often does not block out periferal vision.

And the holiday event is a great touch, too! Blow apart undead Santa and creepy, crawly reindeer, giant gingerbread men and more!

Give it a try. Look me up, and let's destroy some specimens!

Survive wave after wave of zombies if you can. The more zombies you kill the more money you make to buy better weapons.  Five levels of difficulty. Easy through Hell on Earth. You can play as both Melee and Ranged zombie fighters. Great game def.. worth the money.

Killing Floor is a great Survival Game.You earn money by killing experiments or zombies if you wish to call them that and you can use that money to buy new weapons and work your way up to the most powerful weapon in the game.The only DLCs you have to pay for are just character packs and new maps and weapons are still free and maybe continue to be free.
The graphics may not be impressive, but the gameplay is definitely amazing and got me addicted to this awesome game. I got my money's worth for sure.

Trying to choose between KF and Left for Dead? Here's the beef: If you want polished-up graphics, different game modes, player-versus-player etc. choose L4D. For everything else such as a personal progress system, gory fun and the thrill of massacring zombies with your friends; choose Killing Floor.

Intense non-stop first person shooter based zombie action with you at the heart of it in an often dark, gritty yet sometimes humourous game world atmosphere. Hilarious voice acted command system, impressive weapon and player class trader system to satisfy all, intelligent varied AI that will have you chilled and laughing one moment and serious and terrified the next while pushing your awarenss ability to its limits and beyond - all combining for a most amazing unique online co-op experience where team performance and being the hero both have a part to play when it comes to surviving the onslaught of zombie waves, or falling victim as their next meal. Work hard, and you will be rewarded, survive successfully - and you will have a chance for an epic showdown with the Patriarch.
Nice and mindless. Not the graphic quality of L4D, but it's it's own kind of fun.

This game is easily one of the most enjoyable zombie killing shooters currently available.
Even more than a year after release it is still being supported by its developers, receiving upgrades and new content on a regular basis.
The graphics engine might be slightly outdated and the teamplay oriented frantic gameplay is probably not suited for everyone, but with that low price tag and all the additional content available through the community (i.e. whitelisted maps), this is a must-have for anyone even remotely interested in the zombie horror apocalypse genre.
